data.text: @CAFalk Re-try him. Keep it simple. Make the case that someone in a "consensual relationship" with someone else doesn't need to drug them.
@CAFalk Who's going to believe Dr. Huxtable is a rapist? Add that to how victims are demonized in the first place, and you have a witch's brew.
@CAFalk He abused his position as a trustee to lure an employee of the university to his home, and took advantage of her because he knew he could.
@CAFalk My wife calls people all the time; does that mean she's "in a relationship" with some of them? No. Numbers of calls don't mean anything.
@CAFalk The case comes down to a famous person using undue influence to "mentor" a woman he intended to have sexual relations with, without consent.
@CAFalk Ask yourself: if this "relationship" was a "consensual" as Cosby makes it out to be, why the drugs? He admitted to them, in the deposition.
@CAFalk The victim worked at Temple. Cosby was a trustee. Perhaps she was afraid if she revealed what went on Temple would fire her.
@CAFalk I honestly don't know how they couldn't pull this off. They got hung up in the crap over the phone calls. The calls prove NOTHING.
